intro: Rosa majalis var. pumila, commonly known as the dwarf shrub rose, is a compact, deciduous shrub native to parts of Asia, particularly China. It features small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has a sprawling growth habit with multiple stems and is characterized by its dense, thorny foliage. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a border plant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its persistent, showy flowers and attractive, reddish-brown hips that appear in autumn.
